results.title: Architype
results.creator_credit: Henry Lutman, Colin Thomas and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Conversations”.
This brilliant short animation directed and animated by Henry Lutman uses a real conversation recording to portray two architects discussing a plan to build a new shopping mall. While the characters flick through large technical drafts of the mall a homeless man walks across the pages to reveal the social consequences of redevelopment and to show the viewer between the lines of the real conversation. The film outstandingly shows a multiplex of possible realities- the real conversation recording - the animated architects and a homeless man minimally draw into the stark architectural line drawings. The animated characters begin to seem more realistic than the real conversation recording the film is based on. This title is part of a series of animated films made by the BBC called Animated Conversations.

results.title: Filling time
results.creator_credit: Andy Walker, Colin Thomas, BBC and Aardman Animations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Conversations”.
Another in the series of films whose starting point is the sound track, made by pinning a radio microphone to the central character. The resulting ‘natural conversation’ was edited down to five minutes and the animator allowed free visual interpretation. This one is about a visit to the dentist.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andy Walker, Colin Thomas, BBC and Aardman Animations

results.title: Down and out
results.creator_credit: Peter Lord, David Sproxton, Colin Thomas and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Conversations”.
Based on a real life conversation, clay models are animated to act out the problems of a man attempting to get a meal from a welfare agency.

results.title: Swimming
results.brief_description: A young girl is given a video recorder as a gift. Structured as a video and super-8 diary, this compelling short film investigates the devastating effects on a child of adult secrets. This exceptional Australian short film is a first person narrative conveyed completely through point of view and mise-en-scene. Cast features Steve Jacobs and Lynette Curran.

results.title: Roadside cafe
results.brief_description: A lonely young woman working in an isolated roadhouse is desperate to escape the inevitability of her future. She makes hopeful overtures toward the only people that she meets - the truckies and families who frequent the cafe but is met with ugliness and hostility. Cast features LeVerne McDonnell. Original format 16mm/colour.
